Each household is different, but in general the children will benefit from the same support and care that children receive in more traditional households. They will also participate in activities that a traditional biological parent wouldn’t necessarily be involved with, like selecting a middle school, or planning their vacations. These types of events will vary, depending on how involved the parents want to be in their children’s lives, and also in large part on how their families and friends support them.
